preprocessor.name: #assert
preprocessor.desc: Allows definition of preprocessor variables that do not conflict with names in the program name space

preprocessor.name: #define
preprocessor.desc: When the preprocessor encounters this directive, it replaces any occurrence of identifier in the rest of the code by replacement

preprocessor.name: #elif
preprocessor.desc: Specify some condition to be met in order for the portion of code they surround to be compiled

preprocessor.name: #else
preprocessor.desc: Specify some condition to be met in order for the portion of code they surround to be compiled

preprocessor.name: #endif
preprocessor.desc: Closes an #if directive

preprocessor.name: #error
preprocessor.desc: Aborts the compilation process when it is found, generating a compilation the error that can be specified as its parameter

preprocessor.name: #ident
preprocessor.desc: Inserts a comment into the generated script

preprocessor.name: #sccs
preprocessor.desc: Inserts a comment into the generated script

preprocessor.name: #if
preprocessor.desc: Specifies some condition to be met in order for the portion of code they surround to be compiled

preprocessor.name: #ifdef
preprocessor.desc: Allows a section of a program to be compiled only if the macro that is specified as the parameter has been defined, no matter which its value is

preprocessor.name: #ifndef
preprocessor.desc: The code between #ifndef and #endif directives is only compiled if the specified identifier has not been previously defined

preprocessor.name: #import
preprocessor.desc: Instructs the preprocessor to look for type library files first in the directory of the file that contains the #import statement, and then in the directories of whatever files that include (#include) that file

preprocessor.name: #include
preprocessor.desc: When the preprocessor finds an #include directive it replaces it by the entire content of the specified file

preprocessor.name: #include_next Instructs the preprocessor to continue searching for the specified file name, and to include the subsequent instance encountered after the current directory
#line
preprocessor.desc: Controls the line number and file name

preprocessor.name: #pragma
preprocessor.desc: This directive is used to specify diverse options to the compiler. These options are specific for the platform and the compiler you use

preprocessor.name: #unassert
preprocessor.desc: Closes an #assert directive

preprocessor.name: #undef
preprocessor.desc: Undefines #define macro

preprocessor.name: #warning
preprocessor.desc: Generate a level one warning from a specific location in your code

preprocessor.name: #switch
preprocessor.desc: Allows selection among multiple sections of code, depending on the value of an integral expression

preprocessor.name: #case
preprocessor.desc: Used with #switch in a union

preprocessor.name: #break
preprocessor.desc: Stops processing further lines in a #switch directive
